SEARCH
Module PFE
Package app.frontend

Class AuthLoginController

java.lang.Object
app.frontend.AuthLoginController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AuthLoginController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controller class for the login screen. Handles user authentication, password visibility toggling, and navigation to other screens.
Author:
Sellami Mohamed Odai

  • Method Details

    • getCurrentUser

      public static User getCurrentUser()
      Returns the current logged-in user.
      Returns:
      The current user or null if no user is logged in

    • setCurrentUser

      public static void setCurrentUser(User user)
      Sets the current logged-in user.
      Parameters:
      user - The user to set as current user

    • loadLoginView

      public static void loadLoginView(javafx.stage.Stage stage) throws IOException
      Loads the login view for a given stage. Sets up the scene, configures stage properties and ensures proper layout.
      Parameters:
      stage - The stage to load the login view into
      Throws:
      IOException - If the login view cannot be loaded

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes the controller. Sets up database connection and configures the password text field.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The location used to resolve relative paths
      resourceBundle - The resources used by this controller

    • togglePasswordVisibility

      public void togglePasswordVisibility()
      Toggles visibility of the password between masked and clear text. Switches between password field and text field while preserving the input value.

    • handleLogin

      public void handleLogin(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the login button click event. Validates user input, authenticates credentials and navigates to the appropriate screen.
      Parameters:
      event - The action event triggered by the login button

    • navigateToSignup

      public void navigateToSignup(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Navigates to the signup screen when the signup button is clicked.
      Parameters:
      event - The action event triggered by the signup button
